com.itko.lisa.remote.client

Class NetworkClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.lisa.remote.client.AbstractClient
      • com.itko.lisa.remote.client.NetworkClient

  • public class NetworkClient
extends AbstractClient
    Various methods to control or monitor the network usage of this process

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.itko.lisa.remote.client.AbstractClient

        m_agentClient

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getBytesReceived()
      Returns the num bytes read on the socket since last reset
      long getBytesSent()
      Returns the num bytes written on the socket since last reset
      long getEstimatedThroughput()
      Gets the estimated network throughput at the time of the last call
      java.util.Date getFirstReceiveTime()
      The time of the first receive on this thread since the last reset
      java.util.Date getFirstSendTime()
      The time of the first send on this thread since the last reset
      java.util.Date getLastReceiveTime()
      The time of the last receive on this thread
      java.util.Date getLastSendTime()
      The time of the last send on this thread
      long getNetworkPlusServerTime()
      Gets the time spent on the network and the server for the last network call
      void installSocketTracker(boolean global)
      Start tracking socket usage on the client to use in reconciling client and server transactions.
      void reset()
      Resets all internal counters
      void startSpoofing(int mode, java.util.List ips)
      Start spoofing IPs by returning one of the supplied ips from a list (or all available ones on the default interface if the list is null or empty), according to a set algorithm
      void stopSpoofing()
      Resume returning the default IP for the default interface
      void throttle(int throughput)
      Sets the max throughput in bytes per second - 0 means no max
      void uninstallSocketTracker(boolean global)
      Stop tracking socket usage on the client to use in reconciling client and server transactions.

    • Method Detail

      • installSocketTracker

        public void installSocketTracker(boolean global)
        Start tracking socket usage on the client to use in reconciling client and server transactions. This must be called prior to the call we're adding in addClientTransaction.
        Parameters:
        global -

      • uninstallSocketTracker

        public void uninstallSocketTracker(boolean global)
        Stop tracking socket usage on the client to use in reconciling client and server transactions. This should be called after the call we're adding in addClientTransaction.
        Parameters:
        global -

        Resets all internal counters

      • getNetworkPlusServerTime

        public long getNetworkPlusServerTime()
        Gets the time spent on the network and the server for the last network call
        Returns:
        -1 if unavailable for some reason

      • getEstimatedThroughput

        public long getEstimatedThroughput()
        Gets the estimated network throughput at the time of the last call
        Returns:
        -1 if could not be calculated (for ex. all the payload was received in one or two packet)

      • throttle

        public void throttle(int throughput)
        Sets the max throughput in bytes per second - 0 means no max
        Parameters:
        throughput -

      • startSpoofing

        public void startSpoofing(int mode,
                 java.util.List ips)
        Start spoofing IPs by returning one of the supplied ips from a list (or all available ones on the default interface if the list is null or empty), according to a set algorithm
        Parameters:
        mode -
        ips -

      • stopSpoofing

        public void stopSpoofing()
        Resume returning the default IP for the default interface
